title: Vincent Blanc
text:
Vincent Blanc (born 1973) is a retired <a href="France">French</a> alpine skier.
He competed in two events at the <a href="World%20Junior%20Alpine%20Skiing%20Championships%201992">1992 Junior World Championships</a>, finishing lowly in both super-G and downhill. He would compete internationally in these events exclusively, achieving the most in downhill races.
He made his <a href="Alpine%20Skiing%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a> debut in December 1995 in <a href="Gr%C3%B6den">Gröden</a>. He collected his first World Cup points with a 25th place in the December 1996 <a href="Bormio">Bormio</a> downhill. In 1997–98 he steadily improved to 23rd in <a href="Beaver%20Creek%2C%20CO">Beaver Creek</a>, 22nd in <a href="Garmisch-Partenkirchen">Garmisch-Partenkirchen</a> and 18th in <a href="Val%20d%27Isere">Val d'Isere</a>; all in the downhill event. After reaching a career best World Cup placement in the January 2000 Kitzbühel downhill, finishing 17th, the 2001 Kitzbühel downhill was his last World Cup outing.
He stoped competition when his first child was born.
He represented the sports club SC GD Bornan.
Currently Vincent Blanc live in <a href="French%20Alps">French Alps</a> near <a href="Grenoble">Grenoble</a>.
